page.title: 02FARMING IN TORTHORWALD
page.content: {Dairy Farming.} The kind of cows we keep are Friesians and a little Ayrshires. We put them on good grassland. The cows eat grass, cake, silage, hay and barley.If the calves are beef we keep them but if they are dairy we sell certain ones. An average dairy farm has 100 cows which takes up 60 acres for grazing. Most of the milk goes to the Carnation Condensing Plant. {Sheep Farming. The sheep around here are mostly Swale dales, Suffolks, Greyfaces, Cheviot and Border Leicester. The sheep graze on grass they eat barley,hay and turnips. We usually dip sheep in June or July. We shear the sheep in June or July with electrical shears or clippers.
